channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024060186
item.description:
Report X-2024060186

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, WE RESPONDED TO A DECLARED LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE HAD AN APPROPRIATE SHIPPING PAPER, DIAMOND LABEL AND MARKING OF UN2796 BATTERY FLUID ACID. THE PACKAGE HAD SUCCESSFULLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACLILITY IN ILLINOIS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) ONE LITER BOTTLE OF GILL AIRCRAFT BATTERY ELECTROLYTE LEAKING FROM A PIN HOLE IN THE BOTTOM OF THE BOTTLE.

item.description:

  • State: KY

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package came to QA because it had a wet box and was leaking. Upon inspection it was determined that the contents of the package, a wet acid battery, was leaking. The battery was leaking through its casing. Package is waiting PGH disposition.
